   11197             : /*
   11198             :  * Generate a C string representing a relation's reloptions, or NULL if none.
   11199             :  */
   11200             : static char *
   11201         588 : flatten_reloptions(Oid relid)
   11202             : {
   11203         588 :     char       *result = NULL;
   11204             :     HeapTuple   tuple;
   11205             :     Datum       reloptions;
   11206             :     bool        isnull;
   11207             : 
   11208         588 :     tuple = SearchSysCache1(RELOID, ObjectIdGetDatum(relid));
   11209         588 :     if (!HeapTupleIsValid(tuple))
   11210           0 :         elog(ERROR, "cache lookup failed for relation %u", relid);
   11211             : 
   11212         588 :     reloptions = SysCacheGetAttr(RELOID, tuple,
   11213             :                                  Anum_pg_class_reloptions, &isnull);
   11214         588 :     if (!isnull)
   11215             :     {
   11216             :         StringInfoData buf;
   11217             :         Datum      *options;
   11218             :         int         noptions;
   11219             :         int         i;
   11220             : 
   11221           0 :         initStringInfo(&buf);
   11222             : 
   11223           0 :         deconstruct_array(DatumGetArrayTypeP(reloptions),
   11224             :                           TEXTOID, -1, false, 'i',
   11225             :                           &options, NULL, &noptions);
   11226             : 
   11227           0 :         for (i = 0; i < noptions; i++)
   11228             :         {
   11229           0 :             char       *option = TextDatumGetCString(options[i]);
   11230             :             char       *name;
   11231             :             char       *separator;
   11232             :             char       *value;
   11233             : 
   11234             :             /*
   11235             :              * Each array element should have the form name=value.  If the "="
   11236             :              * is missing for some reason, treat it like an empty value.
   11237             :              */
   11238           0 :             name = option;
   11239           0 :             separator = strchr(option, '=');
   11240           0 :             if (separator)
   11241             :             {
   11242           0 :                 *separator = '\0';
   11243           0 :                 value = separator + 1;
   11244             :             }
   11245             :             else
   11246           0 :                 value = "";
   11247             : 
   11248           0 :             if (i > 0)
   11249           0 :                 appendStringInfoString(&buf, ", ");
   11250           0 :             appendStringInfo(&buf, "%s=", quote_identifier(name));
   11251             : 
   11252             :             /*
   11253             :              * In general we need to quote the value; but to avoid unnecessary
   11254             :              * clutter, do not quote if it is an identifier that would not
   11255             :              * need quoting.  (We could also allow numbers, but that is a bit
   11256             :              * trickier than it looks --- for example, are leading zeroes
   11257             :              * significant?  We don't want to assume very much here about what
   11258             :              * custom reloptions might mean.)
   11259             :              */
   11260           0 :             if (quote_identifier(value) == value)
   11261           0 :                 appendStringInfoString(&buf, value);
   11262             :             else
   11263           0 :                 simple_quote_literal(&buf, value);
   11264             : 
   11265           0 :             pfree(option);
   11266             :         }
   11267             : 
   11268           0 :         result = buf.data;
   11269             :     }
   11270             : 
   11271         588 :     ReleaseSysCache(tuple);
   11272             : 
   11273         588 :     return result;
   11274             : }
